Award.AwardTitle: The 5th International Congress on Sustainability Science and Engineering

Division.LongName: Div Of Chem, Bioeng, Env, & Transp Sys

Award.AbstractNarration:
1642400
Huang, Yinlun

The purpose of the 5th ICOSSE (International Congress on Sustainability Science and Engineering) is to exchange emerging ideas about ways and means of protecting the environment and its resources and ensuring sustainable industrial development. The congress will provide a common platform for researchers and practitioners of various physical and ecological sciences, engineering fields, economics, and social sciences from around the world, especially from the U.S. and Asian countries. The ICOSSE will be organized on the following key themes in sustainability: (1) sustainable technologies in processing industries, (2) sustainable manufacturing, (3) nanotechnology sustainability, (4) energy for sustainability, (5) environmental sustainability & industrial ecology, and (6) sustainability education. Presentations are expected to focus on pursuing industrial sustainability from the systems perspective using scientific and engineering innovations. The conference should help bridge the gap between research and development, strengthen the linkage between academia and industries, and explore opportunities for broad international collaboration, especially with those in Asia. The conference will be held in Soochow, China, October 24-27, 2016. This grant is to assist in the travel support for U.S. faculty and their students to participate.

This ICOSSE will provide an excellent opportunity for U.S. academic attendees to exchange research and educational experiences with world-class leaders and other colleagues, especially those in Asia and near regions, and to identify international collaboration opportunities in strengthening sustainable engineering research and education. Junior faculty members, young researchers, graduate and undergraduate students, especially those minorities underrepresented in science and engineering, will be strongly encouraged to attend the conference. A student poster paper competition will provide an excellent opportunity for them to present their research activities and receive advice from leading experts from different countries. A publication based on the conference will be generated.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The project was to provide travel support to U.S. academic participants to attend the 5th International Congress on Sustainability Science and Engineering (ICOSSE5), which was held in Suzhou, China, October 24-27, 2016. This was the first time for the ICOSSE conference series to have its event in Asia. The conference was co-organized by AIChE and Suzhou University of China. The purpose of the conference was to exchange emerging ideas about ways and means of protecting the environment and its resources and ensuring sustainable industrial development. It provided a common platform for the researchers and practitioners of various physical and ecological sciences, engineering fields, economics, and social sciences from around the world, especially from the U.S. and Asian countries.

The conference helped bridge the gap between research and development, strengthen the linkage between academia and industries, and explore opportunities for broad international collaboration, especially with those in Asia. The conference attracted about 250 participants from 9 countries, including Australia, Belgium, China, Ecuador, India, Indonesia, Singapore, Thailand, and United States. The two and a half day conference had 6 plenary talks, 60 oral presentations including 13 keynotes in 14 technical sessions, and one student poster session. There were 32 poster papers, most of which were contributed by undergraduate and graduate students. There was also a technical exhibition arranged for Chinese companies to introduce their technologies and products.

The journal, ASTM International Journal of Smart and Sustainable Manufacturing Systems, published a special issue on Smart and Sustainable Manufacturing in Energy Intense Process Industries as Volume 2, Issue 2, in 2018.  The special issue publication was partially supported by this NSF grant (No. 1642400).
